sys_metadata_link.payload:
Setup inbound REST API using DIP platform to be able to use Postman to create or update incidents in ServiceNow.

 

After sending message to SNOW you should get response similar to this one:

{
    "request_id": "555fe01b83181210ee9ce290ceaad341",
    "dip_package": "mock",
    "dip_case": "inbound",
    "status": "Success",
    "operation": "Create and update",
    "result": "Updated",
    "message": "Record 57af7aec73d423002728660c4cf6a71c was correctly updated.",
    "data": {}
}
 
and values in created/updated ticket should reflect what you sent into the instance.
Note that according to mapping file 'number' is used as identifier so if you use number of existing incident the incident should be updated by API. If you use number that does not yet exist in the instance, API will create new one.
 
OPTIONAL:
you can also try playing around with mapping of additional fields.
 
]]> true false not requested ca8c03c0932b02100580f55a7bba10e7 product false automatic Feature false Goal of this exercise is to create simple inbound API that processes inbound messages and creates or updates incident records. For this purpose we will use DIP to automate the process and Postman to sent messages to DIP API. DIP user guide: https://docs.google.com/document/d/191_vbhNHEnmLbvatorY_dsSjJQcK5LSJUpAsWlouJjQ/edit Postman request guide: https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/requests/ Requirements: 1. Create user "dip_service" that will be used for authorization against SNOW. Make sure that the user has "x_devo2_dip.Inbound API" role. 2. Create DIP package OR reuse package created in previous story (story number STRY0010068). 3. In the package add "dip_service" user into the authorizations tab. 4. Create new DIP case using job "inbound eBonding". 5. Set table as "Incident" and operation as "create and update". 5. Create mapping according to attached mapping document in the related table at the bottom of the form. Testing procedure 1. In Postman prepare new POST message. 2. Set endpoint as https://{instance_name}.service-now.com/api/x_devo2_dip/dip/trans/{package_name}/{case_name} 3. set authentication as basic and use details of "dip_service" user. 4. as body template you can use example in attachments of this story. 5. try changing values in the message body and check if they are reflected in SNOW. Hints: 1. In the mapping table, in case of inbound message "Source" field should hold attribute name used in the JSON. "Target" field is system name of SNOW field that you want to map the attribute to. 1970-01-02 00:00:00 2024-09-02 2024-09-02 09:33:01 39398b0c93e702100580f55a7bba1007 0 4000200000 false 3 false false sys_metadata_link.sys_name: Create custom Inbound REST API to update incidents
